Officers contacted woman’s PO, who requested that she be...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 1.22.25
entry.summary: From the Umpqua National Forest office, Jake Winn and Ryan Seebold talk about a proposed amendment to the Northwest Forest Plan and a community meeting that will be held to talk about it on January 28th.

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH 12:00 P.M. FRIDAY
entry.summary: January 22, 2025 4:10 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory continues through 12:00 p.m. Friday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said poor air quality will continue. This is due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions near the surface that will continue to trap pollutants. The Advisory area includes the...

entry.title: ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT FAILURE LEADS TO MASSIVE OUTAGE TUESDAY
entry.summary: January 22, 2025 4:00 a.m. The failure of a piece of electrical equipment in a central substation led to a massive power outage around Douglas County on Tuesday morning. Pacific Power Senior Communications Specialist Simon Gutierrez told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the outage began impacting customers in the Roseburg district at...

entry.title: BLM ANNOUNCES ROAD 25-7-29 CLOSURE
entry.summary: January 22, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management Swiftwater Field Office, Roseburg District has announced that BLM road 25-7-29 is closed to through traffic. A BLM release said the recent rain events have undercut the road, and the edge of the road has collapsed. This is a public access road accessible from both...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WARMING CENTER ACTIVATION CONTINUES WEDNESDAY NIGHT

entry.title: TEMPORARY CLOSURE OF WHISTLER’S BEND COUNTY PARK

entry.title: MUCH OF COUNTY STARTS MORNING WITHOUT POWER
entry.summary: January 21, 2205 11:30 a.m. Much of Douglas County started Tuesday morning without power. Shortly after 5:00 a.m. tens of thousands of Pacific Power customers had their power go out. That also impacted a significant percentage of the members of Douglas Electric Co-operative as well. Pacific Power Regional Business Manager Sam Carter said a transmission...

entry.title: DCSO ISSUES SCAM ALERT
entry.summary: January 20, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has issued a scam alert. A release said scammers continue to impersonate local law enforcement, including those from DCSO, to extract money from victims. Many residents have recently reported fictitious phone calls from unknown callers claiming to be from law enforcement. Often these callers will...

entry.title: ROSEBURG FOREST PRODUCTS NAMES NEW PLANT MANAGERS

entry.title: JOEY KOENIG PROMOTED TO PRESIDENT OF 7ROBOTICS

entry.title: WORKSHOP FOR PEOPLE INTERESTED IN BEEKEEPING
entry.summary: January 20, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Oregon State University Extension Service and Umpqua Valley Beekeepers are having an event for community members interested in becoming beekeepers. Extension and Umpqua Valley Beekeepers Association will hold the Buzz Academy workshop on Saturday February 22nd. It will take place from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. at the extension...

entry.title: Oregon Pair Arrested for Posing as Firefighters During Palisades Fire Emergency
entry.summary: Two Oregon residents were arrested Saturday in Los Angeles County after allegedly impersonating firefighters and attempting to enter an evacuation zone during the active Palisades Fire. Dustin Nehl, 31, and Jennifer Nehl, 44, were discovered operating a fire truck purchased at auction while wearing firefighter turnout gear and CAL-Fire t-shirts.

entry.title: FREEZING FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: January 19, 2024 6:50 a.m. A Freezing Fog Advisory is in effect through 10:00 a.m. Sunday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of one quarter mile or less in freezing fog is expected. The Advisory area includes central Douglas County, Josephine and Jackson counties and eastern Curry County....
